Articles.Content:
I'm not sure if I'm 32bit or 64 bit or if it matters.

http://www./download/x63unhhhjjrz9r4/Experimental_Ion_Jet_launcher_concept.craft This is a very large part computer intensive experimental ship. I need to scale it down and figure out how to make it workable. But you will get the idea trying it. You want a good computer to run this though. 500+ parts nearly 80t in weight. almost made it out off kerbin.

The base idea seems sound from what I've done so far. I just need to scale it correctly. It's a small basic probe core. Some 1x1 organized in oct in 3 sections and put in ion/batteries/generator/struts/xenon pods. After that I put some basic jet engines with intakes 150 fuel per pod and control device on top that uses electricity. Very simple. but I need to figure out what i need to do to make it usable.

BTW, I went with basic jets for fuel efficiency to get into orbit.(needs better thrust to weights.) and ion for longevity and weight of the fuel. It has 150x8=1200 jet thrust for in atmosphere and 104 ion engines for 208 additional thrust. It also has 84,000 xenon gas. needs to have the electrical and several other things balanced and the weight reduced or more jets added.

You may be able to get some amount of control by using SAS(which should be on the whole time anyway) and using teh auto functions to go in that direction. They are fix while it is rotating in a general direction. If you select the right one you can tilt towards that direction slowly. So there is some steering some of the time.

http://

Edited January 3, 2015 by Arugela

http://www./download/q2y346jbs6sd568/Mothership_alpha_lite.craft This can get into stable orbit! It just needs to be scaled up and given more fuel for trips beyond Kerbin. As xenon is the lightest fuel in existence I don't think that will be difficult to add. My bigger oversize model(which was not scaled to get in orbit well.) had 84,000 fuel. It lacked electrical. And had to many loose struts. Struts add weight quickly on this design, but are needed to keep stuff from flying off on takeoff from the jet engines spin.

Warining: File may be 32 bit or 64 bit. I'm uncertain which one I'm playing.

I just put this into a circular orbit around Kerbin at 161km.

Self propelled Self guilded Jet/Ion space explorer:

Stats:

Parts: 321

Mass: 35.7t

Height: 4.9m

Width: 5m

Length: 5m

Ion engine cluster: (1ion+12generators= 1.21t +.2715 excess energy production.Cost: 45,300)(Every 32.14917127 Ions gives a free extra ion engine. Or pays for some of the rest of your ship energy needs potentially)


  • [*=1]
    1x8 PB-Ion Electric Propulsion System engines (69.828e)

    [*=1]
    12x8=96 PB-NUK Radioisotope Thermoelectric Generator (+72 energy) (+2.172e/s) (I have an extra 8 Stabilizers but this would not be needed when doubling this or beyond.)

    [*=1]
    1x8=5600 PB-X150 Xenon container (can be scaled by weight much higher than this.)

    [*=1]
    1x8=1600 Z-200 Rechargeable Battery Bank

Weight: 9.68t (just Ion and Generators)

Other Weight: User preference

Jet engine cluster:


  • [*=1]1x8 MK1 liquid fuel fuselage
    [*=1]1x8 TurboJet engine
    [*=1]1x8 Advanced inline stabilizers
    [*=1]1x8 Shock Cone Intake
    [*=1]6x8 Structural Intake

Structure:


  • [*=1]1x1 Probodobodyne OKTO2
    [*=1]2x8 M-1x1 Structural Panel
    [*=1]12x8 EAS-4 Strut Connectors

Shortcuts:


  • [*=1]Custom1: Toggle Ion engines
    [*=1]Custom2: Toggle Jet engines

Instructions to get into orbit: Use thrust to get desired altitude. Cut engines on jets and stop spin(if needed) to re-aim for desired angle. Attempt to gain max speed before leaving orbit like a spaceplane. Maximize speed before leaving oxygen environment. When high enough use Ions to make circular orbit at desired altitude. You can use the ions to help with ascent also.

This design could both branch into an ion engine cluster for a larger ship or the beginnings of an idea for a UFO saucer design.

Edited January 3, 2015 by Arugela

Struts are physicsless, they add no mass.

The thermo generators are the least efficient power generation. Replace them with some '400' batteries (also massless) and add a couple of Gigantor panels. Obv don't open them in atmo, but the jets should help power the ions.

Edited January 3, 2015 by kahlzun

I just checked. My mass value goes up as I add them in the rocket creation building. Does it ignore it on runway?

I know they are the least efficient. I used them for endless energy for the test. As it scales it will allow extra engines though. And The panels can't be placed in a way to be useful because of how many engines and parts this would eventually use up. You could never control them all.(or I haven't figure out a convenient way yet.) The generators were just easier to do. And once in orbit it could work for getting the orbit circle finished.

I could also strip the jet part and use them as Ion clusters for a bigger structure and provide a better out of atmospheric propulsion method. But I need to fill out the physical area with more ions to make it useful. the problem is I think my comp can't handle that many parts yet. I'll have to wait for the game to become more efficient to make a truly large one potentially. It would make a cool Deep space Ion cluster. I could add alot more to this.

Yea, If i used solar panels It would have to be with this added to a different structure and them placed separately. That isn't bad though. I could count on the additional energy elsewhere and use less gens as I scale the entire engine structure for more ions. Then use this as a bigger ships rear engine or something. Regardless I still prefer having some ammount of electricity available to the ions at all times. It's just nicer. And the Ions don't play nice or turn off when out of energy for some reason. so if I ever lost them it would be permanent.

do any of the batteries self generate. I could use that, or at least add that into my calculations for an engine design. I already have a cluster of 400 batteries in the design btw.

Edited January 3, 2015 by Arugela

First of your engine's are under a angle, so you lose trust.

second, you want to go to orbit? Use turbojetengine's the get better trust as you go higher. Basic engine's are for low ground flights or vtol engine's.

Hope the info helps

Gr reaper

https://www./folder/mf2q2c319gjvk0f,ed3yca5m6k0u44g,wslcxt222ppoatx,lu3kfw5t7oxhx7f/shared <- Here is the assembly parts for the ION engine and turbojet compartments. There are also two example craft that do not twist when flying. they are easy to stear. One has more ion thrusters than the other but is heavier and laggier.

It does use turbojets.
Apparently someone already beat me to the punch!! 8D
